risks.Risk Description: A ubiquitous concern identified by 78% of respondents as high or very high risk, relating to potential threats against the organization’s information systems.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology drives this risk as it is one of the top three risk areas, along with IT and third‐party relationships.

risks.Trend: Cybersecurity risk levels have remained elevated compared to 2019 levels.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with the organization’s information technology, recognized as a high risk area driven by technological dependency.

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology drives IT risk as it is one of the three highest risk areas highlighted by respondents.

risks.Contextual Variations: Rated lower by CAEs at publicly traded organizations compared to financial services.

risks.Risk Description: The third highest risk area, concerning relationships with external vendors and third parties (often used for IT services).

Risk Driver.Driver Description: Technology drives this risk since reliance on external IT service providers increases exposure.

Contextual Variations: Publicly traded organizations rate this risk lower compared to financial services.
Among privately held organizations, it is rated as the second highest risk area.

risks.Risk Description: Risk related to compliance and regulatory issues, excluding concerns about internal controls over financial reporting (ICFR).
risks.Contextual Variations: CAEs at publicly traded organizations tend to rate this risk lower compared to those in financial services.

risks.Risk Description: Risk arising from day-to-day operations including potential process inefficiencies and systemic failures.
risks.Trend: Audit allocations for operational auditing have been reduced since 2019.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with enterprise risk management and the processes linked to managing overall risk.
Risk related to the potential occurrence of fraudulent activities; nearly half of CAEs indicated responsibility for fraud investigations.
Risk associated with deficiencies in corporate governance structures and organizational culture.
risks.Trend: There is a 20 percentage point gap where audit frequency is lower than the perceived risk level.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with internal controls over financial reporting and compliance, including aspects related to Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX).
risks.Trend: For publicly traded organizations, allocation to financial reporting has decreased for the first time in three years.
Contextual Variations: Privately held organizations with SOX implementation allocate significantly more (28%) compared to those without (5%).
Public sector and nonprofit organizations generally allocate little to this risk due to limited SOX requirements.

risks.Risk Description: Risk arising from initiatives aimed at reducing costs and expenses, which has received increased attention since 2020.
risks.Trend: Audit allocation for cost/expense reduction is trending upward since 2019.
risks.Contextual Variations: Nonprofit organizations report a much higher risk level for cost/expense reduction compared to other sectors.

risks.Risk Description: Risk associated with financial areas not related to internal controls over financial reporting.
Risk related to sustainability issues and non-financial reporting, with over 60% of respondents in publicly traded organizations rating it as moderate, high, or very high.
risks.Trend: Audit allocation for sustainability/non-financial reporting has increased notably since 2019.
Contextual Variations: Public sector respondents (52%) also view sustainability/non-financial reporting risk as moderate to high.

risks.Risk Description: Risk related to issues that impact the external audit process, noted by the fact that audit frequency for this area is 45 percentage points higher than its perceived risk.
